Picture description: A robber drops his valuables
Card text: You dropped all your stuff you clumsy idiot. Discard a card

Picture description: A rusty lockbox
Card text: The lock is broken. Search through the deck for an Item worth $ and take it. Discard the Lockbox and shuffle the deck.

Picture description: A robber with a sledgehammer looks proud next to a broken wall
Card text: If there are any, reveal any undiscovered rooms adjacent to the one you are in. Draw cards for discovering these rooms as normal.

Picture description: A cute little beetle with puppy dog eyes
Card text: You are scared of bugs, run away. The previous player in turn order can move you up to two rooms away (You cannot discover new rooms.) Only take the effect of the room you stop in.

Picture description: A close up of a robber's eyes with doors in them
Card text: You feel as though you remember this place. Reveal any two undiscovered rooms.

Picture description: Goo sprays from a sink and pipes burst.
Card text: Goo and muck spray from the pipes and flow through the halls! All players are Dirty and Wet and must discard all but 3 cards. Items hidden in Pockets are safe.
You're rich!! ...Or are you? The treasure you've collected vanishes to dust. All players must discard a Treasure card or $$$ worth of items. If you can't do either, you have no imagination.
A card from a legally non-specific card game! Reverse the order of play.
A mist of slippery butter fills the halls. All players must discard an item from the player to the left of them.

Picture description: A scared robber hiding under some blankets while a thought bubble above him shows a swarm of scary bugs
Card text: A swarm of angry bugs fill the room... Or do they? Either way you empty your pockets in a panic. All players must take all pocketed cards and play them immediately

Picture description: A bunch of thieves stealing from each other
Card text: A bunch of tiny portals appear around you, through which you can see pockets. All player's must attempt to steal an item from the player previous in turn order to them. Pockets are safe.

Picture description: A tired-looking genie in casual clothes next to a surprised/confused robber holding his lamp
Card text: Draw 3 cards, pick one and return the other two to the top of the deck in any order "Like, can we just do one wish today? I'm really not up for it right now"

Picture description: A small potted plant with a monocle and a long cigarette
Card text: A classy potted plant makes you self conscious, Discard your lowest value item. If you have nothing you feel unaccomplished as a robber, which causes you to lose your next turn.
I can't turn them off! Pick a direction, move in that direction until you hit a wall, undiscovered room, or a room with another player.

Picture description: A robber eats an invisible feast.
Card text: WOW so much food... Maybe?? All players must discard all food items and then draw as many cards as they discarded.

Picture description: A comma
Card text: You accidentally forgot to import your card spreadsheet into a csv reader that can handle commas in data fields! Discard one Item card that has a comma somewhere in its text.

Picture description: A well sucks in robbers while saying "well well well"
Card text: Every player moves to the same space as the player who drew this card

Picture description: A robber with looney-tunes style whirlwind feet, zooming through a room, screaming.
Card text: The player to your left moves you 3 spaces, you suffer the effect of every room you pass. You cannot discover new rooms along the way

Picture description: A Calendar with wednesday circled and like confetti or something
Card text: Pick a player, swap spaces on the board, and trade all items. Pockets are safe.

Picture description: Robber, starved to the bone, in a foggy room
Card text: A cruel miasma of insatiability engulfs the room. Must... Consume... Everyone must discard two cards (including Pockets and cards in them).
Comments: move differently, take from other players

Card text: I curse you! One day... You will die!

Card Name: One of a Kind Action Man!(tm) (1/2)
Picture description: Generic superhero action figure
Card text: Wow! Mint condition! If more than one robber exits the mansion with this "one of a kind" figurine, it is worthless.
Comments: there are 3 of these. A: maybe extra value if you have the set

Card Name: One of a Kind Action Man!(tm) (2/2)
Picture description: Generic superhero action figure
Card text: Wow! Mint condition! If more than one robber exits the mansion with this "one of a kind" figurine, it is worthless.
Comments: there are 3 of these. A: maybe extra value if you have the set

Picture description: Footstool, duh
Card text: There's something high up on that shelf... Discard this card to draw on card from the deck.

Picture description: A worn and smelly booklet
Card text: You've mastered the coveted art of dumpster diving. Well you skimmed it anyway. Draw any card from the discard pile and then discard this card.

Picture description: Spray paint can
Card text: Place this card on any item that is not already Gold. That item's value is now doubled. Place this card with the spray-painted card. They act as one card for the rest of the game. If discarded they become separated.
Comments: A: Specify that this card is no longer value $$

Picture description: Shiny jewels in a dirty wooden box that glows brown
Card text: It glows beige with the aura of okness. This item cannot be stolen because why would they even bother?

Picture description: Nike-esque sneakers
Card text: These shoes aren't amazing, but they're not bad either. You can move again on your turn.

Picture description: a burlap sack stuffed with random crap
Card text: Oh hey, somebody already collected this loot and put it in a bag! Because it is already loot stuffed in a bag, this item cannot be put in a Pocket.

Picture description: a crumy little plastic sports trophy
Card text: Oh wow! This is worthless! On your turn, you can award another Robber in the same room as you with this trophy for participating in the break-in and give it to them.

Picture description: pseudo-yugioh card looking thing
Card text: This is some really valuable cardboard! If you ever become Wet, discard this card.

Card Name: Globe with the Soviet Union on it
Picture description: globe clearly showing the USSR on it
Card text: It's outdated, but still a pretty nice globe

Picture description: Cool Sunglasses
Card text: Block out the haters

Picture description: A really shiny, new penny
Card text: Lucky find!

Picture description: A quarter where washington has goofy glasses and a moustash
Card text: Oh, wow, coins with errors are actually pretty rare!

Picture description: A garbage looking japanese-style sword
Card text: Negate another players attempt to steal from you. (this may be played directly from a Pocket)

Picture description: Gloves covered in some kind of slime
Card text: Your hands are so sticky! Whenever this card would be removed, keep this card and draw the top card from the discard pile. Discard without this effect if the player becomes WET.

Picture description: A toy claw arm
Card text: If you succeed a steal roll, you can steal from on of their Pocket. Discard after use
You may play this card directly from a pocket on anyones turn. When you use this card send any players in the same room as you to any room adjacent to you. You cannot discover new rooms this way.

Picture description: A crankable machine with a wooden arm and hand
Card text: If you are in a room with another robber you can make them discard a card of their choice. Keep this card

Card Name: Egard Fredman's Stinkonomics for the Modern World 3rd Edition
Picture description: A textbook

Card Name: Book of the Church of Stan
Picture description: A normal guy
Card text: Stan's a pretty chill guy. Play this to deny another player's steal. (after a successful roll)

Picture description: A robber lifts a car with ease
Card text: This improbably light car is a joy to drive, but it doesn't go very fast. Move again on your turn. This item is too big to fit in a Pocket.

Picture description: A creepy little doll holding a book that says "LAISSEZ-FAIRE" on it
Card text: You may swap cards of equal value with a player in the same room. Discard after use.

Picture description: a little iphone looking thing with a smug looking face on it
Card text: A computer with a personality. Unfotunately, it's a dick, and nobody wants it around. If you ever become Wet, you get electrocuted and must discard this card and two others.

Picture description: A skateboard with a thermometer and an icepack
Card text: The sickest board you've ever seen. Can't do any tricks but can roll very slowly until it gets tired. Move again on your turn.
Comments: may eventually turn this into a cursed item

Picture description: A fedora with a dark aura coming off of it
Card text: Not actually haunted. Just a terrible hat that reeks of hair grease

Picture description: A ceremonial butter knife dripping with butter
Card text: Discard two cards, draw one. Keep this card

Picture description: A rack of nice gems that glow yellow
Card text: It glows yellow with the aura of light bouncing off of it. This item serves no purpose other than to look nice.

Picture description: A key made of bones with a little bowtie
Card text: This key is very charismatic. Discover a room of your choice and move to the that room. Then discard this card.

Picture description: A dapper hazmat suit
Card text: For those occasions that are fun and radioactive. When you enter a room, play this card to negate its effect. Discard after use

Card Name: I Can't Believe It's Not Sacrificial Butter
Picture description: A tub of margerine tied to a stone table
Card text: If you land on another player's space and they have Sacrificial Butter, you can steal it. Discard this card.
Comments: Maybe there should be an "I can't beilieve it's not the butter God"

Picture description: small, matte black ball in a red devil hand wearing a white suit sleeve coming out of the shadows toward the viewer
Card text: at the start of your turn, trade this item with one random item from the player previous to you in turn order.
Comments: Add room that unhaunts the card when the room appears. Ball moves in the opposite direction of play

Picture description: A journal with a little dream catcher draw on it.
Card text: Writing down your dream makes it real! Too real? You must draw from the bottom of the deck instead of the top as long you have this card. If anything Imaginary happens to you, you must discard this card.

Picture description: A fish
Card text: A slimy fish.

Picture description: A spork
Card text: This spork vibrates randomly. You hear the call of penguins in the distance. Swap the room your standing in with any other room in the house (anyone inside that room goes with it). Discard after use.

Picture description: A Kingly Scepter
Card text: Instead of moving, you may order another player to move instead, taking the affect of whatever room they land in. If you discover new rooms this way, you take the card.

Picture description: A single beautiful diamond ring that glows green
Card text: It glows green with the aura of greed. All of your items are now worth one extra $. If this card would otherwise be stolen it is instead discarded.

Picture description: A "screenshot" of a blog that says: "Hey all you cool Shoggoths..."
Card text: Gain insight into the secrets of the undead! It's mostly recipes. Haunt or unhaunt yours or another player's card. Discard after use.

Picture description: A weird photocopier with glowing eldritch symbols all over it
Card text: If this card is in your hand at the end of the game, double the value of a single item in your hand.

Picture description: A dank-ass sock.
Card text: No one wants to look in here. A Pocket.

Card Name: A Plastic Bag Filled With Plastic Bags
Picture description: A bag filled with bags
Card text: This one counts as 2 Pockets because of all the extra bags!

Picture description: A pocket
Card text: You've had this the whole time. Why can I only use it now? A Pocket

Picture description: A tote bag with apples and shit on it
Card text: A Pocket. Food hidden here at the end of the game is worth double.

Picture description: A big scary coat on a coat hanger
Card text: You can keep all kind of shady stuff in here. A Pocket

Picture description: A box with little feet that says "Insmuth Movers" on it
Card text: A Pocket. If there is no item hidden here you can move again on your turn.

Picture description: A question mark
Card text: Shhh don't tell anyone! Hide a card here.

Picture description: A matress with a pile of cash bursting from under it
Card text: Banks are a construct of the bourgoisie! A Pocket

Picture description: A chest with teeth in it
Card text: A Pocket. You must discard a card to remove it from the pocket.

Picture description: flat-fish looking alien latching onto a robber
Card text: The hideous monster leaps from the shadows and latches onto you! It seems friendly enough. You can hide an item in here, but it won't give it back until the end of the game. A Pocket

Picture description: forks and knives covered in gunk and grime
Card text: The owners of this place don't do the dishes apparently. Mysterious Goo is getting on your stuff. Take them to the kitchen to clean them, turning them into Nice Silverware.

Picture description: Shiny forks and knives
Card text: Real silver! The knives are sharp and the forks are perfect for twirling spaghetti. If you get dirty, turn them back into Dirty Silverware.

Picture description: A peice of a puzzle that appears to be a picture of a monster
Card text: The monster in the picture seems angry! Collect all three to unhaunt all of them. They cannot be stolen.

Picture description: A finished puzzle with a picture of a monster
Card text: Pretty picture!

Picture description: A peice of a puzzle that appears to be a picture of a monster
Card text: The monster in the picture seems angry! Collect all three to unhaunt all of them. They cannot be stolen.

Picture description: A finished puzzle with a picture of a monster
Card text: Pretty picture!

Picture description: A peice of a puzzle that appears to be a picture of a monster
Card text: The monster in the picture seems angry! Collect all three to unhaunt all of them. They cannot be stolen.

Picture description: A finished puzzle with a picture of a monster
Card text: Pretty picture!

Picture description: A torn painting of a creepy young guy with glowing green eyes
Card text: This picutre is so scary! You think it keeps taking your things, but you feel younger when you have it. You can move again during your turn. Take to the portrait hall and discard a weapon to unhaunt.

Card Name: Regular Painting of an Old Guy
Picture description: A painting of a nice old man
Card text: This picture is so boring! But a famous painter signed it so it's worth more.

Picture description: A galaxy with a scruffy beard
Card text: The unkempt dreams of trillions throughout the multiverse calls to you. It's breath kinda smells. Collect the Shitty Fake Katana and the Haunted Fedora to unhaunt this item.

Picture description: A Knight in shining armour holds a katana in one hand and wears a fedora over his helmet
Card text: This gallant knight comes to the aid of all, whether they want it or not. Instead of moving, you may teleport to another players space. While on another players space you may sacrifice an item to get into their pockets, stealing a hidden item of your choice.

Picture description: Disgruntled robber with pockets full of sand
Card text: This item must either occupy a Pocket, or you must discard it. This card can be brought to the Bathroom or the Laundry Room to be turned into a Sack of Sand.

Picture description: The sack of sand that Idaho Jim used to steal the Idol
Card text: On your turn, you may swap this item with a Treasure in another player's hand. When you receive this item, flip it over to Pocket Sand and put it in a Pocket. Adios, seÃ±or.
Comments: take from other players, give to other players

Picture description: Gross Egg
Card text: This egg can be brought to the Hatchery to turn into the Golden Goose.

Picture description: Honking golden goose
Card text: This noisy jerk is worth a lot, but subtract one from future steal rolls

Picture description: one of those mechanical singing wall fish things looking all weird and mystical
Card text: Haunted. Before drawing cards on your turn, you can choose to consult the Fish Prophet. When you do, change this card into the Silent Fish Prophet. Then, you may look at the top three cards of the deck and put them back in any order.

Picture description: one of those mechanical singing wall fish things looking very normal
Card text: Unhaunted. The Fish Prophet has Spoken, and shall Speak no more.

Picture description: TBD
Card text: TBD

Picture description: TBD
Card text: TBD

Picture description: A furnace with a face
Card text: Discard a Flammable Item to draw two cards. Can be used any amount of times. Unhaunt if player becomes Wet.

Picture description: A cold furnace
Card text: Does nothing. Rehaunt if the player becomes burnt.

Picture description: TBD
Card text: TBD

Picture description: TBD
Card text: TBD

Picture description: Glasses with angry eyes behind them
Card text: These glasses make your vision terrifyingly sharp. You can see atoms. Entering the Dark Room to turn this card to the Nonchanted Eyewear

Picture description: Glasses
Card text: These glasses are not your perscription. Everything is a little blurry, but at least they're worth something now

Picture description: Butter tied to a stone table
Card text: Sacrilicious! Discard the Sacrificial Butter Knife to summon the Butter God.

Picture description: A monster made of butter
Card text: You now control the Butter God. Every player but you must discard one item of your choice. Discard this card after use.

Picture description: A egyptian sacrophagus
Card text: I wonder what's inside... Unhaunt at any time

Picture description: an angry mummy
Card text: At the start of your turn, discard any card with a value >= 0. This card cannot be stolen, removed or hidden.

Picture description: A purse with a galaxy inside it
Card text: A cute and trendy handbag that grants access to your own universe.

Picture description: A purse with nothing inside of it
Card text: I guess it was the pocket dimension that made it cute. Discard cards that add up to at least $$$$$ to switch it to the Dimensional Purse

Picture description: Ghosts wander the halls as robbers hide
Card text: Hungry ghosts begin to appear in the halls! Very scary! If it hasn't already been done, take the Act 2 deck and shuffle it with Act 1. Each player must place a Ghost token on a room. If you land on a room with a ghost token, you must sacrifice a card to leave the room. The first player to make it to the graveyard with a haunted item (in their haunted state) banishes the ghosts and can take this card as a prize.

Picture description: A bluprint stands like the carpet from alladin
Card text: The floor rumbles and the house begins to shift. If it hasn't already been done, take the Act 3 deck and shuffle it in with the others. At the beginning of each players turn, they must take a room and move it anywhere else that is adjacent to another room. The first player to discover the last room in the house banishes this card and takes it as a prize. If the whole mansion has already been discovered, play rock paper scissors to see who wins.

Picture description: A tentacle faced man stands silhouetted in a doorway
Card text: Dr. Carl Thulu has returned from the night shift! He's very tired and irritable. After you've finished reading this card, put it adjacent to any room on the edge of the house. This is the Front Door. If you land on this space you are free! Take the Dr Thulu Piece and put it on this card. At the start of each players turn, they must move Dr Thulu 2 spaces. If you start your turn adjacent to the room Dr Thulu is in, he grouchily disintegrates you, removing you from the board (you can still take your turn moving Dr Thulu). Once all players have either escaped or been disintegrated, the heist is over! (if you escape, add $$$ to your final total, if you get disintegrated, count up your money normally. Just because your a pile of ash doesn't mean you can't win)
